title: If we are living in a simulation, what are we simulating assuming a simulation is based on reality? - Quora

response.answer_text: The reality we perceive may be simulated. If so, it may have nothing at all to do with ‘real reality’. Just like a VR game: like Myst, or Warcraft, or whatever. However you want to assume this simulation is, indeed, ‘based on reality’. If so the obvious guess is: it’s based on the world of our ‘master programmers’ - the people (or person) who created / programmed our simulator, and cursed us with it. How similar is their world to the one they’ve stuck us in? You might think it’s impossible to even speculate, but, believe it or not, the question has some meat to it! We can actually make informed guesses, based on low-level facts such as QM and physics in general; and also high-level facts such as the types of society we experience. But it would be too much trouble at this time to get into it. Let me know if you’re interested in pursuing this difficult topic further.
